intro: Pleonotoma dispar, commonly known as the slender flat bark beetle, is a species of beetle belonging to the family Curculionidae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender body and a distinctive, flattened exoskeleton. The plant-associated life cycle of Pleonotoma dispar involves feeding on the bark of specific host trees, primarily in the genus Ficus. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a herbivorous insect that influences the health and ecology of its host plants. The beetle's presence can indicate the health and diversity of the forest ecosystem in which it resides.
